data.scheme_name: Strengthening of Pharmaceuticals Industry- Assistance to Pharmaceutical Industry for Common Facilities (APICF) - Except NER & Hill States
data.benefits: Scheme provides incentive of upto 70% of the project cost of the Common Infrastructure Facilities (CIF) or Rs 2000 lakhs, whichever is less.
data.eligibility: All existing Pharma clusters and MSMEs and Pharmaceutical manufacturing units in a cluster who have come together to form a Special Purpose Vehicle (SPV) to execute the project of developing common facility.
data.conditions: Lease period for land/building must be at least 30 years.SPV must contribute 30% of the project cost, with no duplicate funding.Administrative support assistance can't exceed 5% of the grant-in-aid.Projects to be completed in 2 years.The SPV must have at least 5 pharma units as members and be a separate legal entity registered under the Companies Act or the Registration of Societies Act.The eligible activities under this sub-scheme in order of priority is as under:Research and Development LabsTesting Laboratory for Pharma ProductsEffluent Treatment PlantsLogistic CentresTraining CentreThe Grants-in-Aid shall not be available to any individual production units, if any, owned by a member of the SPV.The combined net worth of all members in the SPV must equal the total grant amount applied for. Additionally, each SPV member must have a net worth at least 1.5 times their proposed equity contribution.The SPV members shall be legally independent entities without any related-party relationship with each other.
data.beneficiaries: All existing Pharma clusters and MSMEs and Pharmaceutical manufacturing units in a cluster who have come together to form a Special Purpose Vehicle (SPV) to execute the project of developing common facility.

data.context: This scheme addresses the demand and requirement for support to already existing pharma clusters and MSMEs to improve productivity, quality and sustainability.
data.objective: To strengthen the existing pharmaceutical clusters’ capacity for their sustained growth by creating tangible assets as “Common Facilities”.
data.description: Scheme provides incentive of upto 70% of the project cost of the Common Infrastructure Facilities (CIF) or Rs 2000 lakhs, whichever is less.
data.how_to_apply: Visit the online portal developed by the Small Industries Development Bank of India (SIDBI), the Project Management Consultant (PMC) for the scheme.Register your application at this portal:- https://spi.udyamimitra.in/
data.funding_mechanism: The applicant will get the benefits in the following installments :1st installment : 30% funds will be released after final project approval2nd installment : 30% funds will be released after submitting bills, with 60% of the 1st instalment utilized and proportionate expenses incurred.3rd installment : 30% funds will be released after submitting bills, 100% utilization of 1st instalment, 60% utilization of 2ns installment4th installment : 10% funds will be released once the SPV has fully mobilized, utilized the entire grant, and spent its full share.
data.additional_info: SPV shall be responsible for O&M of assets created under the scheme by way of collecting user charges from the members/users.
